class_g_06_home_01: Put away your phones. It is time to begin class.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_02:
While you’re out performing fieldwork with one
of your Pokémon walking alongside you...[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_03: have you ever noticed changes in its coloration?[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_04:
Now I don’t mean that it suddenly becomes a
Shiny Pokémon or any nonsense like that.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_05: I am speaking of it becoming filthy![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_06:
Pokémon battle! They get hurt by moves used
against them![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_07:
They get battered by wind and rain! They get
covered in sand and mud![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_08: They get, in a word, filthy![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_09:
I have seen many a Trainer walking about with
their adorable little Pokémon without addressing\r
this issue. It is deplorable.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_10:
Let me ask this question of someone who I am
sure would not tolerate such shameful conduct.\r
Ah yes, M[aster;iss:g] [trnm:0].[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_11: What should you do if your Pokémon is dirty?[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_answer_01:
Perfectly correct! I knew I could count on you to
provide me with such an answer.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_answer_02:
While patting your Pokémon on the head to
express appreciation for its hard work would\r
make for an adorable moment, that would not\r
clean it of its filth![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_answer_03:
I suppose, in time, filth accumulated from rain
and mud may well fall of its own accord...but I\r
never expected such an answer from you.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_12:
When your Pokémon are dirty, clean them!
This is, of course, simply common sense.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_13:
While you are having a picnic, you can approach
the Pokémon on your team and perform a\r
variety of actions.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_14:
One such action is putting them through what I
like to call the “Pokémon Wash”... In other words,\r
you are able to clean them up![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_15:
You start by getting your sponge lathered up with
soapy bubbles as you gently and carefully scrub\r
your Pokémon.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_16:
Once your Pokémon is nice and covered in
soapy bubbles...[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_17:
the bubbles will encapsulate the filth, then you
simply wash it away with a spray of water![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_18:
This will get your Pokémon clean and shining
bright as a Tera Jewel![npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_19:
It is certainly quite a bit of work, but this will
also restore HP and cure status conditions.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_20:
However, some Pokémon may have parts of their
bodies that they don’t want scrubbed or that\r
they would rather not get wet.\c
Be sure to keep this in mind when cleaning your
Pokémon.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_21:
Now, the most important point that I must
mention is that some Pokémon LIKE to be dirty.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_22:
Though I will contradict myself by saying this,
please do remember that cleaning your Pokémon\r
is not always the kind thing to do.[npcn:29]
class_g_06_home_23:
Our time together has come to an end for today.
I bid you all farewell.[npcn:29]
